title: Connecting to mssql with authentication=ActiveDirectoryPassword fails since 2.12.0.Final
body:
### Describe the bug

When connecting to an azure-deployed MS SQL and using 

```properties
quarkus.datasource.jdbc.additional-jdbc-properties.authentication=ActiveDirectoryPassword
```
the application fails to create a connection.

### Expected behavior

Application connects, and database can be used.

### Actual behavior

### How to Reproduce?

- Deploy a MS SQL through azure, allow access through a corresponding AD user, and expose the database
- Checkout https://github.com/turing85/quarkus-with-mssql:
```bash
git clone https://github.com/turing85/quarkus-with-mssql.git
cd quarkus-with-mssql
```
- Open [`pom.xml`](https://github.com/turing85/quarkus-with-mssql/blob/main/pom.xml#L16), notice that `quarkus.version` is set to `2.12.0.Final` (the first version failing the test)
- Open [`application.properties`](https://github.com/turing85/quarkus-with-mssql/blob/main/src/main/resources/application.properties) and configure the database-connection by setting `db.name`, `db.host`, `quarkus.datasource.username` and `quarkus.datasource.password`
- Build the application, run the tests:
```bash
./mvnw clean test
```
- Observe the above exception
- Open `pom.xml`, change `quarkus.version` from `2.12.0.Final` to `2.12.0.CR1`
- Re-run the tests:
```bash
./mvnw clean test
```

- The current `3.x` release (`3.2.0.Final`) has the issue as well
